Title: Coming from AirPods Pro 1st Gen

They recommended me to get a new pair and the upgrade would be worth it instead of paying for replacements out of warranty.Thanked them and left the Apple Store, said I would think about it. Checked Amazon and they were on sale for $199. Bought the AppleCare too.They ARE better. The noise cancellation is definitely better and the sound profile is better. You get 4 sizes of ear tips now instead of 3. Charging case is better as well with a speaker for finding them. No regrets at all.

Title: Don't buy these
Review: I HATE these AirPods. Connecting them to my iPhone is a nightmare. they never connect the first time. If you take one off for a moment and then put it back on the pair refuse to play together until I take them both out and put them back on together. No one can hear me talk on the phone when I use them for phone calls. Everyone says I sound muffled or like I am underwater. on top of these issues they fallout constantly. it is extremely stupid and irritating. I have tried troubleshooting, switching the ear cushions etc. nothing is working. I had the 2nd generation AirPods (not pro) and they were great. the sound was great, I never had issues with them falling out or people not being able to hear me talk on the phone. There's a reason they still sell those. These are not worth the cost. I am going to sell them and buy Sony earbuds.

Title: An upgrade from first generation.
Review: More features and much better noise cancellation system. Well worth the upgrade. Also got a good deal which made it even better.

Title: Awesome AirPods Pro!
Review: Four stars! I received these AirPods Pro as a Christmas gift last year and immediately loved them! I appreciate these AirPods for their design, functionality and features.To begin, the new generation of AirPods Pro has a sleek design with shorter arms. The shorter arms make the AirPods look more modern and prevents from getting caught on your shirt/sweater when changing. The earbuds also now include silicone ear tips for more comfort. The purchase comes with 4 extra replaceable ear tips that offer different sizes or your unique ear shape as well. This is helpful to find your specific size. I havent experienced any trouble with the earbuds staying put in my ears. The case is slightly larger than previous generations, which makes it easier to find when digging in your bag to grab them, however still compact enough to easily fit into pockets. On the case, you‚Äôll find a speaker that plays sounds to locate in case lost and alerts you when the battery is running low, a charging port and lanyard loop.Second, the AirPods Pro score highly when it comes to functionality. The sound quality is great and highly improved in comparison to previous models. It has clear, crisp sound and rich bass which makes the experience much more enjoyable. I feel like I‚Äôm in the studio! This new generation offers Active Noise Cancellation. This greatly helps block out any surrounding noise that distracts whatever you‚Äôre listening to. On the other hand, the AirPods Pro also offer Transparency mode. This mode makes it useful to easily hear your surroundings while your audio remains playing. It has an echo effect that slightly tunes out the music while mainly focusing on voices directly in front of you. Basically, this is the opposite of the ANC feature I previously mentioned.Lastly, similar to the older AirPods, the case includes a built-in lightning charger as well as a charging port. It has a 6 hour battery life from a single charge! A 4 ft cord is also provided in the box. The new U1 chip enables the Find My feature with precise finding for the case.Aside from the pricetag, I am very impressed with the new, extra features that the AirPods Pro offers!

Title: Amazing!
Review: Had the last gen and upgraded after loosing them. New ones blew me away! Fidelity beyond anything I‚Äôve heard in an earbud style. Battery goes forever!

Title: Full of known issues ranging from software to hardware
Review: I received these as a gift on Christmas back in 2020. I would say it‚Äôs been a good few years that these have worked, but that would be a false statement. From the beginning there were multiple instances of connection issues to my iPhone. The headphones have a known issue of making rattling, buzzing and vibration sounds, with or without noise cancellation on. This was pointed out to me by Apple customer service. I had to send these in twice when they were under warranty to have each earbud replaced for this reason, which only increased the connectivity issues even after going through the pairing and resetting guide with and without help from customer service. Despite this, the new earbuds I received had the EXACT same issues that I had to send them in for originally, and they were out of warranty. I refused to spend 1/3 of the cost of a brand new set on repair service, so I‚Äôve been dealing with the strange buzzing sounds ever since (about 1.5 years of buzzing). Despite frequent software updates, my right headphone no longer responded to ‚ÄúHey Siri‚Äù commands, completely ignoring them. Ever since I received the first new pair, I‚Äôve had friends complain how they can‚Äôt hear me well when I use them for phone calls. Finally, the very last straw from this product was when the case would not charge my AirPods. I fully charged the case for multiple hours, and the battery of the case would flicker from 100% while charging to 0% immediately after I removed the charger from the case. Now the case only charges the AirPods while the case is on the charger. I looked it up and it is a battery fail issue, which would cost me money to have replaced. Probably over $100 repair. I decided I would rather spend my money on a $40 pair of bluetooth noise cancelling headphones that would likely do a better job at the mangled mess of failed operations that my AirPods did in the last 2 years of use.The noise cancellation is okay, I have a pair of Bose headphones that do a better job that I would use instead if that‚Äôs what I was looking for. ‚ÄúHey Siri‚Äù commands are nice if they work (like only my left headphone would). Sound quality is good but nothing special. Would I recommend these? No. Get yourself a better functioning pair, you‚Äôre only paying for name brand here.

Title: Item stopped working
Review: Both left and right ear will not work and even though product is under warranty Apple will not repair it. This might have been refurbished or water damaged from seller and now I‚Äôm stuck with this crap. Don‚Äôt buy it!

Title: very comfortable
Review: I am delighted to provide a glowing review for the Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation) Wireless Earbuds. These earbuds are an incredible piece of technology that provides an amazing audio experience like no other.The standout feature of the AirPods Pro is the active noise cancelling technology. With up to 2x more active noise cancelling than the previous generation, these earbuds provide an incredibly immersive audio experience. I was amazed at how effectively they blocked out background noise, making it easy to fully concentrate on my music or podcasts.But what really sets these earbuds apart is the adaptive transparency feature. This feature allows me to hear important external sounds, like traffic or a person speaking to me, while still enjoying my audio content. It's an incredibly useful feature that ensures I stay safe and aware of my surroundings while still enjoying my audio.The sound quality of the AirPods Pro is top-notch as well. The bass is deep and rich, while the mid-range and treble are crisp and clear. Whether I'm listening to music or podcasts, the audio is always balanced and enjoyable.The earbuds themselves are also comfortable and easy to wear. The silicone tips fit securely in my ears and the earbuds stay in place even during vigorous exercise. And with the wireless charging case, I never have to worry about running out of battery.Overall, I highly recommend the Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation) Wireless Earbuds. They are an incredible piece of technology that provide an immersive audio experience and a comfortable fit. If you're in the market for high-quality earbuds, the AirPods Pro are definitely worth considering.

Title: Had Bose before but this is much better with Apple phones
Review: The Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation) are an excellent choice for anyone looking for a high-quality pair of wireless earbuds with exceptional noise cancellation. Whether you are on the Long Island Rail Road or an airplane, the AirPods Pro's Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) technology can block out ambient noise, providing a more immersive listening experience. The Transparency mode also allows you to hear your surroundings when necessary, making them a safe option for use while commuting. Additionally, the AirPods Pro have a comfortable, ergonomic design that fits snugly in your ear, and the sound quality is superb. Overall, the Apple AirPods are an excellent investment for those who value noise cancellation and high-quality audio.

Please comment below if you have had the same issue and can recommend a non-Apple wireless pair of earbuds.

Title: Wind Noise Terrible vs Gen 1
Review: Expected much improved performance vs. Gen 1 but wind noise (such as while riding a bike) is much worse. Found sound quality and noise cancellation improved (except wind noise). The wind noise is so much worse than Gen 1 the air pods are almost useless while riding a bike. Called Apple for help (they are usually great) but seems like they are in denial on this issue. An internet search revealed numerous complaints similar to mine. This is a major tarnish on Apple's reputation in my mind..... especially the lack of help. I do recall Bose having an issue with their sleep buds and they admitted the problem, offered refunds and eventually launched an improved product. Don't understand why Apple will not admit their problem

Title: Best air pods
Review: Great and light weight and affordable

Title: Insane Sound, Quiet Background
Review: Don't look for other earbuds. Seriously. I have tried every pair of earbuds Apple has made. I have also tried Sony's latest headphones that are "industry leading," as well as a pair of Bose's headphones with ANC. These are either the same or better than all of those products. The sheer amount of features and unexpected quirks and the flow of UI on my phone make it worth the buy. You might think 200 dollars is expensive for earbuds, and I will say it is. But if you are looking for high-end sound in a comfortable earbud, then this is it. I will say that the battery life is slightly worse than I expected for the price. I wished they would last slightly longer. As of right now with use of like 12 hours every two days I am charging them about twice a week. Best wireless earbuds ever.

Title: NOT FAKE!
Review: Very nice and loud if you want spatial audio you have to go to accessibility scroll down to audio/visual and if you have mono audio take it off the turn on spatial audio and it basically sounds like the music is following you if you turn your head left you hear it in your left if you turn your head right you hear it in your right. But overall very good and not fake.Also of you would like to check if it is fake go to checkcoverage.apple.com and type in the serial number and if it pops up your airpods it isnt fake and if it pop up a error sign it is fake

Title: Defective, slow support
Review: Within five minutes of trying them on for the first time, the right earbud started making a loud hissing, squealing sound. This would come and go. They were perfect for a 2.5 hour flight. But after about two weeks, they were doing this after just a couple of minutes.It took 45 minutes with Apple support before they agreed that maybe they should take them back for "repair" and another 25 minutes to work out the return. Not to mention my time to drive them to a UPS Store, where the entire concept of returning Apple products seemed new to them. By comparison, I contacted support for my 3D printer recently and it took them 3 minutes to diagnose my problem and ship me a replacement part.I suppose I would have been better off with an appointment at an Apple store, but I was afraid they would work perfectly in the store (this seems to happen more in quiet locations).
